result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary J Rymus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Terminated Regular - 12/11/18
to Judge Slate from the defendant re: payment of probation monies
of Conviction - Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - for 1 year (08/29/2019)  Court sentences the defendant to 30 days of conditional jail to commence within 90 days if not paid.

1:24 p.m.  Defendant present in court via telephone and without counsel.  Agent Mike Pulice present in court.  Statement by the Court - allowed the defendant to appear via telephone as she had a migraine headache.  Statement by the defendant in regards to non-payment of monies, will file the paperwork to DOR today.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court sentences the defendant to 30 days conditional jail to commence in 90 days if not paid.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.  

Court adjourned at 1:30 p.m.
Probation review hearing on July 16, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (08/29/2018)

1:36 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Michael Pulice present in court.  Statement by defendant, has paid $150.00 and states reasons.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for one year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court informs defendant of the right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:39 p.m.
Probation review hearing on July 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
10:20 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with probation, costs, restitution and DNA, and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  Statement by DA Christenson.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent .
-Restitution - $481.06
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 10:27 a.m.
By Atty Joey Roeth

10:59 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court rescinds any warrant there were ordered earlier.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant requests an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 13, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.
